pr_title: Add content previewing client and service decorators

timeline.message:
Add content previewing client and service decorators
Motivation:
Related #2189

We currently, store `HttpData`s to the `ContentPreviewer` right before writing to the socket to preview the content.
However, this makes the server decompress twice when there's a `EncodingService` and a user wants to preview decompressed content.
It's also, not the way we do for this kinds of thing which is intercepting the requests and responses and manipulating.
We use decorators for that.

Modifications:
- Add `ContentPreviewingClient` and `ContentPreviewingService`

Result:
- Close #2189

replies.bodyText:
Oops. 😅
Well, I was actually planning to remove ContentPreviewerFactory.disabled() and ContentPreviewer.disabled() because we usually use just null value for the disability.
The reason why we introduce disabled() is, I guess, because of MappedContentPreviewerFactory which iterates all of the factories until it finds a valid return value.
I think I want to remove that as well. 😅
ContentPreviewer can be created only after the request or response headers is available which means that we can pass the headers when we create ContentPreviewer. Then, we don't have to call ContentPreviewer.onHeaders() all the time.
In order to do that, we need to modify the methods which takes Supplier<? extends ContentPreviewer> as a parameter in ContentPreviewerFactory. For example, we should change of(MediaType contentType, Supplier<? extends ContentPreviewer> supplier) to of(Function<? super HttpHeaders, ? extends ContentPreviewer> function). If we do that, I think we can remove MappedContentPreviewerFactory.
WDYT @anuraaga?
